Expectation1: Maintain client confidentiality and ethical standards
Situation1: During a casual networking event, someone casually asks about the nature of a client’s case.
Expectation2: Follow the instructions and guidelines provided by the volunteer coordinator
Situation2: New safety steps were highlighted during the last briefing and everyone was asked to apply them consistently.
Story: I stood at the edge of the crowded room, balancing a glass of sparkling water and a name tag that read “Attorney & Volunteer.” The networking event buzzed with small talk, and I was just starting to relax when a fellow volunteer, Mark, sidled up beside me. “Hey, I heard you’re working on that big case,” he said, lowering his voice. “What’s it about?” I felt the familiar tug of professional duty—client confidentiality was non-negotiable. But Mark was also my teammate at the shelter, and the volunteer coordinator had just emphasized the importance of open communication and trust among us, especially after the new safety protocols were announced. I could sense Mark’s curiosity was genuine, maybe even rooted in concern for the community. My mind raced, torn between the ethical wall I had to maintain as a lawyer and the expectation to be transparent and cooperative as a volunteer. My heart pounded as I weighed my words, feeling the pressure of both roles pressing in from opposite sides, each demanding loyalty in a way that seemed impossible to reconcile.
